dlgPart.npc_text:
After a week of travel you arrive to the ruins of Al-Akia, which at first seem to consist of nothing but a miniature pyramid, barely taller than a grown man. A closer examination of the area reveals three other derelict structures peeking out from the sand, equidistant from the central edifice.
Meru’s soldiers are busy securing the ruins, converting a pile of recently delivered logs into towers and a temporary fence. Fortunately, you’ve arrived before they managed to complete their work, which makes your task easier.
Noticing your arrival, they stop working and form a shield line.

You return to Al-Akia.
Meru’s soldiers are busy securing the ruins, converting a pile of recently delivered logs into towers and a temporary fence. Fortunately, you’ve arrived before they managed to complete their work, which makes your task easier.
Noticing your arrival, they stop working and form a shield line.
“This area is claimed by House Crassus,” says the Decanus, licking his lips. The shit job of securing some ruins under a scorching sun suddenly got a lot worse.

dlgAnsw.text: “Well, it’s also claimed by House Daratan.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “One of those days, eh?” says the Decanus, taking off helmet and wiping the sweat of his face. “So now what?”

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise success]“I suppose, we’ll wait for the reinforcements to arrive.”
“We can fight over it, I suppose.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Yeah,” says the Decanus without any enthusiasm. “Any other ideas?”

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise][charisma]“Sure. The way I see it, it’s all a misunderstanding. Why should we fight and die over it? Tell you what, we’ll sit here and do nothing while you go back to Ganezzar and report to Meru. If Meru sends enough men, we leave and you get a commendation or two. What do you think?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Reinforcements?” repeats the Decanus, cursing his luck and thinking that he should have retired a long time ago. He's almost forty and his odds of getting on the next promotion list are slim to none. Even if he survives this fight.

dlgAnsw.text: “Antidas sent a full legion. We’re the scouting party. I’m surprised Meru didn’t send more men.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “Yeah, me too, but you know how it is. I guess Meru didn’t think someone else would be interested in these ruins now that House Aurelian is gone.”

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise][lore]“Al-Akia is the birthplace of the Gods. This holy site is important to all faithful, not just House Crassus.”

[streetwise][charisma]“The way I see it, it’s all a misunderstanding. Why should we fight and die over it? Tell you what, we’ll sit here and do nothing while you go back to Ganezzar and report to Meru. If Meru sends enough men, we leave and you get a commendation or two. What do you think?”

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]“Wait,” says the Decanus, clearly confused. “So you’re not here to –”

dlgAnsw.text: [persuasion][streetwise]“We’re here to secure the site and make sure no harm will come to it. Brother Meru has really opened my eyes, you see...”

dlgPart.npc_text:
[failure]“Well, we were here first,” says the Decanus after a long mental process. “So we ain't leaving.”
He puts the helmet back on to show his resolve.
[success]“Then we have no reason to fight,” says the Decanus, looking relieved. “I’ll take my men and report back to the Legatus. Then it’s going to be his problem, right?”

[success]“Sounds reasonable,” says the Decanus eagerly. “Nobody would blame me for going back for reinforcements, right?”
At this moment the poor bastard probably imagines himself returning at the head of a large army, instantly promoted and praised for his quick thinking that saved the day.
